page.title: 01 INTRODUCTION
page.content: This block is situated in the county of Tyrone, about sixteen kilometres North of{Omagh.}The main feature in the block is the village of Gorin. "Gortin" is the Gaelic word for "Little Field". The{Owenkillew}river flows from east to west in the northern part of the block. To the south of the valley the land rises steeply with the highest peak being{Mulaghcarn}at 526 metres. The picturesque route from Omagh winds its way down through{Gortin Gap} to the village and then on northwards to Plumbridge, while away to the North East rise the{Sperrin Mountains. Another route from Newtownstewart goes eastwards up the valley to Cookstown. Gortin is at the crossing of these two routes.
